newsitem.title: USA: USDA names Ariz. Ag director Kelly as FSA chief.
newsitem.headline: USDA names Ariz. Ag director Kelly as FSA chief.

text.p: U.S. Agriculture Secretary Dan Glickman on Friday named Arizona agriculture director Keith Kelly to head the Farm Service Agency.

As FSA administrator, Kelly will be in charge of federal farm subsidies, crop insurance, the Conservation Reserve, and farm ownership and operating loan programs. The agency has nearly 20,000 workers at offices across the country.
Grant Buntrock, the previous FSA administrator, resigned in April.
"Given all the challenges facing the agency -- from civil rights to reorganization to the new farm bill -- FSA needs strong leadership. They will get that in Keith Kelly," Glickman said.

Kelly had been Arizona agriculture director since 1990. Before that, he held top slots at Montana Agriculture Department. Kelly also spent time as marketing specialist for the Montana Wheat Commission and as assistant director of Western Wheat Associates, a wheat marketing group, USDA said.
